title: CVE-2011-3892: Double free vulnerability in the Theora decoder

sentences.text: the following CVE (Common Vulnerabilities & Exposures) ids were

| Double free vulnerability in the Theora decoder in Google Chrome | before 15.0.874.120 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of | service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted | stream.

| Google Chrome before 15.0.874.120 does not properly implement the MKV | and Vorbis media handlers, which allows remote attackers to cause a | denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via unspecified vectors.

| Heap-based buffer overflow in the Vorbis decoder in Google Chrome | before 15.0.874.120 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of | service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted | stream.
If you fix the vulnerabilities please also make sure to include the CVE ids in your changelog entry.
This issues also very likely affect ffmpeg in squeeze and before, but I haven't checked that.
Note patches are available on the CVE pages for these issues:
On Mi, Jan 04, 2012 at 01:48:01 (CET), Michael Gilbert wrote:
> Note patches are available on the CVE pages for these issues:
Please send the patches as attachments to this bug.
I'm having a hard time to locate the patches using the URL above.
retitle -1 CVE-2011-3892: Double free vulnerability in the Theora decoder retitle -2 CVE-2011-3893: DoS in MKV demuxer
retitle -3 CVE-2011-3895: heap-based buffer overflow in vorbis decoder forwarded -1 http://bugzilla.libav.org/show_bug.cgi?id=189
On Mi, Jan 04, 2012 at 01:35:33 (CET), Michael Gilbert wrote:
> | Double free vulnerability in the Theora decoder in Google Chrome
> | before 15.0.874.120 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of > | service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted > | stream.
> | Google Chrome before 15.0.874.120 does not properly implement the MKV
> | and Vorbis media handlers, which allows remote attackers to cause a > | denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via unspecified vectors.
> | Heap-based buffer overflow in the Vorbis decoder in Google Chrome
> | before 15.0.874.120 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of > | service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted > | stream.
Please file seperate bugs so that we can track their status individually.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of libav, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 654571@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Reinhard Tartler <siretart@tauware.de> (supplier of updated libav package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)

libav-tools - Multimedia player, server, encoder and transcoder
- Confirm that this release does not inhibit the following security issues:
- Double free vuln in the Theora decoder,
- heap-based buffer overflow in vorbis decoder:
- Bug fix: "libswscale crashes when upscaling pictures using        hyscale_fast2, MMX variant on amd64 with gcc-4.6 and later",
- Clarify that libavutil/avutil.h doesn't include mathematics.h any more in        APIchanges documentation. Thanks: Jonathan Nieder <jrnieder@gmail.com>,
